member.name: M:FluentModbus.ModbusClient.ReadHoldingRegisters``1(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads the specified number of values of type from the holding registers.
member.typeparam: Determines the type of the returned data.
member.param: The unit identifier is used to communicate via devices such as bridges, routers and gateways that use a single IP address to support multiple independent Modbus end units. Thus, the unit identifier is the address of a remote slave connected on a serial line or on other buses. Use the default values 0x00 or 0xFF when communicating to a Modbus server that is directly connected to a TCP/IP network.
The holding register start address for the read operation.
The number of elements of type to read.

Thus, the unit identifier is the address of a remote slave connected on a serial line or on other buses. Use the default values 0x00 or 0xFF when communicating to a Modbus server that is directly connected to a TCP/IP network.
The holding register start address for the read operation.
The number of holding registers (16 bit per register) to read.

member.summary: Only used by the server to indicated that no exception should be returned to the client.

member.name: F:FluentModbus.ModbusExceptionCode.IllegalFunction
member.summary: The function code received in the query is not an allowable action for the server.

member.name: F:FluentModbus.ModbusExceptionCode.IllegalDataAddress
member.summary: The data address received in the query is not an allowable address for the server.

member.name: F:FluentModbus.ModbusExceptionCode.IllegalDataValue
member.summary: A value contained in the query data field is not an allowable value for server.

member.name: F:FluentModbus.ModbusExceptionCode.ServerDeviceFailure
member.summary: An unrecoverable error occurred while the server was attempting to perform the requested action.

member.name: F:FluentModbus.ModbusExceptionCode.Acknowledge
member.summary: Specialized use in conjunction with programming commands. The server has accepted the request and is processing it, but a long duration of time will be required to do so.

member.name: F:FluentModbus.ModbusExceptionCode.ServerDeviceBusy
member.summary: Specialized use in conjunction with programming commands. The engaged in processing a longduration program command.

member.name: F:FluentModbus.ModbusExceptionCode.MemoryParityError
member.summary: Specialized use in conjunction with function codes 20 and 21 and reference type 6, to indicate that the extended file area failed to pass a consistency check.

member.name: F:FluentModbus.ModbusExceptionCode.GatewayPathUnavailable
member.summary: Specialized use in conjunction with gateways, indicates that the gateway was unable to allocate an internal communication path from the input port to the output port for processing the request.

member.name: F:FluentModbus.ModbusExceptionCode.GatewayTargetDeviceFailedToRespond
member.summary: Specialized use in conjunction with gateways, indicates that no response was obtained from the target device.

member.name: T:FluentModbus.ModbusFunctionCode
member.summary: Specifies the action the Modbus server is requested to do.

member.summary: This function code is used to read the contents of a contiguous block of holding registers in a remote device.

member.name: F:FluentModbus.ModbusFunctionCode.WriteMultipleRegisters
member.summary: This function code is used to write a block of contiguous registers (1 to 123 registers) in a remote device.

member.summary: This function code is used to read from 1 to 2000 contiguous status of coils in a remote device.

member.summary: This function code is used to read from 1 to 2000 contiguous status of discrete inputs in a remote device.

member.summary: This function code is used to read from 1 to 125 contiguous input registers in a remote device.

member.summary: This function code is used to write a single output to either ON or OFF in a remote device.

member.name: F:FluentModbus.ModbusFunctionCode.WriteSingleRegister
member.summary: This function code is used to write a single holding register in a remote device.

member.name: F:FluentModbus.ModbusFunctionCode.ReadExceptionStatus
member.summary: This function code is used to read the contents of eight Exception Status outputs in a remote device.

member.name: F:FluentModbus.ModbusFunctionCode.WriteMultipleCoils
member.summary: This function code is used to force each coil in a sequence of coils to either ON or OFF in a remote device.

member.summary: This function code is used to perform a file record read.

member.summary: This function code is used to perform a file record write.

member.name: F:FluentModbus.ModbusFunctionCode.MaskWriteRegister
member.summary: This function code is used to modify the contents of a specified holding register using a combination of an AND mask, an OR mask, and the register's current contents.

member.name: F:FluentModbus.ModbusFunctionCode.ReadWriteMultipleRegisters
member.summary: This function code performs a combination of one read operation and one write operation in a single MODBUS transaction. The write operation is performed before the read.

member.name: F:FluentModbus.ModbusFunctionCode.ReadFifoQueue
member.summary: This function code allows to read the contents of a First-In-First-Out (FIFO) queue of register in a remote device.

member.name: F:FluentModbus.ModbusFunctionCode.Error
member.summary: This function code is added to another function code to indicate that an error occured.

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The function code received in the query is not an allowable action for the server. This may be because the function code is only applicable to newer devices, and was not implemented in the unit selected. It could also indicate that the server is in the wrong state to process a request of this type, for example because it is unconfigured and is being asked to return register values..

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The data address received in the query is not an allowable address for the server. More specifically, the combination of reference number and transfer length is invalid..

member.name: P:FluentModbus.ErrorMessage.ModbusClient_0x03_IllegalDataValue

member.name: P:FluentModbus.ErrorMessage.ModbusClient_0x03_IllegalDataValue_0x7B
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The quantity of registers is out of range (1..123). Make sure to request a minimum of one register. If you use the generic overload methods, please note that a single register consists of 2 bytes. If, for example, 1 x int32 value is requested, this results in a read operation of 2 registers..

member.name: P:FluentModbus.ErrorMessage.ModbusClient_0x03_IllegalDataValue_0x7D
